title.rendered: OWC congratulates ScottishPower Renewables and the East Anglia ONE team

content.rendered:
OWC’s involvement with ScottishPower Renewables’ East Anglia ONE project dates back to 2013, and the global consultant is still involved today as the 714 MW offshore wind farm completes the final commissioning with all her 102 Siemens Gamesa 7 MW turbines now operational.

OWC started by developing the ground model and applied its innovative SI LIVE 1.0 tool to the offshore site investigation (SI) campaign, which was linked to real-time ground modelling. This resulted in significant savings (greater than £4.0m) for the project. OWC has since delivered work and completed numerous other roles on the project, and are still adding value today.

Our work and roles have included the aforementioned geotechnical and structural engineering, cable route design, OFTO package management, construction readiness assessment, senior O&M engineer, senior foundation project manager, installation manager, technical support engineer, onshore site administrators, electrical site manager, Belfast foundation fabrication and QC team, ONSS supply and installation project manager, document management, environmental site advisor and structural inspections among other roles.

“Congratulations to our friends at ScottishPower Renewables and Iberdrola for their incredible achievement.” Said Will Cleverly, OWC managing director. “East Anglia ONE was my first project at OWC, and one I look back on with great fondness. We followed it from Great Yarmouth to Dubai, to China, to the titanic yards of Harland and Woolf. So proud to see it completed and to have been a small part of the success.”

OWC has also worked on Iberdrola’s Wikinger, East Anglia THREE, and East Anglia HUB offshore wind projects and also their US Kittyhawk offshore wind project.

jetpack-related-posts.title: OWC successfully completes the supervision & management of the onshore & overwater cable route site investigation for the East Anglia ONE offshore windfarm
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Offshore Wind Consultants Ltd (OWC), part of the AqualisBraemar group, has successfully completed the supervision and management of the onshore and overwater cable route site investigation for the East Anglia ONE offshore windfarm off the east coast of the UK. This was a high profile and complex investigation using a…

jetpack-related-posts.title: OWC appoints foundations engineer Paul Hatfield to expand competencies
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: OWC, AqualisBraemar’s wholly-owned renewables arm, is delighted to announce the appointment of experienced foundation engineer Paul Hatfield to bolster its engineering team as Principal Foundations Engineer.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Offshore Wind Consultants to support Iberdrola wind farm projects
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: 13 February 2017 – Offshore Wind Consultants Limited, part of Oslo-listed Aqualis ASA, has been awarded a framework agreement by Iberdrola to provide engineering and project management services for various wind farm projects offshore East Anglia, UK. Under the agreement, Offshore Wind Consultants Limited (OWC) will provide engineering consultancy services…

jetpack-related-posts.title: OWC hires project engineering head
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: OWC has hired James Rinkel to head up the development of the company’s project engineering team.

jetpack-related-posts.title: OWC sets up Japan office
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: International offshore wind consultancy and advisory firm OWC has made the decision to set up an office in Tokyo to support the rapidly emerging offshore wind market in Japan.

jetpack-related-posts.title: OWC to support Erebus floating wind farm
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: OWC has entered into a contract to provide engineering services for Simply Blue Energy and Total’s Erebus floating wind project located in the Celtic Sea offshore Wales, UK.
